reviews.review:
Un'esperienza di gioco assolutamente sublime. Un intreccio narrativo degno di un romanzo best-seller ed una grafica dalle meravigliose tinte pastello che nulla ha da invidiare a degli stupendi quadri rinascimentali: questo ed altro fanno da contorno ad un gioco solido, dalle meccaniche profonde, ma intuitive e semplici da gestire. Bioshock Infinite è assolutamente un capolavoro da avere nella propria libreria: tutto, dal primo fotogramma all'ultimo, vi terrà incollati a questo fantastico titolo finché non lo avrete completato. La trama è affascinante e non vedrete l'ora di districare tutti i suoi intrecci ed esplorare ogni singolo meandro dei mondi che illustra. La città di Columbia, con i suoi colori vivaci, caldi ed accesi, vi impressionerà e delizierà, così come la bella Elizabeth, protagonista femminile ed abile assistente nella vostra lotta a Comstock ed i suoi fedeli.
Assolutamente consigliato, dovete e, ripeto, DOVETE averlo nella vostra collezione. Non ve ne pentirete!
This game is amazing.
Fav game of all time, left me speechless at the end, masterpiece.
El mejor juego que he jugado en mucho tiempo en todos los sentidos

O jogo é simplesmente fantástico em sua própria maneira. Sua única, sua bela, sua fluente, e muito narrativa se você está focado em história e eventos acontece durante todo o jogo, basta ser paciente quando você joga, e ser focused- isso é a coisa mais importante, para que você não vai estar com uma perdida cabeça no final. Eu amo os mecanismos e jogabilidade. Além disso, este jogo realmente usa seu cérebro e sua memória o que você fez no jogo desde o início. Elizabeth é um personagens muito bonita e trabalhada. Eu já vi em jogos (um dos melhores possivelmente). E Booker é um bom personagem, assim, a história flui muito bem e isso não faz de você entediado em qualquer lugar. A arma de gancho e, em seguida, a morte de movimento acima é incrível, e usando vigors quando está a filmar é uma ótima combinação. Elizabeth ajuda você a maioria entendeu o jogo como um grande companheiro, passando-lhe a saúde, munição, moeda e sais. E a melhor coisa é que você não precisa cuidar dela, ela sempre encontra um lugar seguro quando você está em combate, meu queixo foi abandonada depois seing o final, mas sim que foi este jogo pretende ser "Bioshock Infnite" ♥, eu recomendo este jogo.

Одна из лучших игр, которые мне довелось поиграть. А переиграл я, не мало игр. 
Скажу сразу: Кен Левин- гений. Ибо только гений смог бы придумать такое. Переплетение РЕАЛИЙ, планы физиков о своем мире, полная противоположность других частей. Рай.
confusing, fun, and at times challenging. it's not like the others, and resembles a corridor shooter, but is a worthy entry.

Games used to be made solely intending to challenge the player, given you had the reflexes etc. to keep up with this you would have fun, otherwise it wasn't much more than a waste of time, and a frustrating one at that.

That being said, games have changed, and this is a prime example of that.
Videogames nowadays have taken to multiple directions, there's rpg's, competitive shooters, arcade styled games and some more. Then there's the genre this game falls into, and arguably, the prior bioshock games as well. To me these games feel more like an interactive movie than an actual challenge, this being intentional or not. There's videogames which try too hard to be like a movie, meaning half the game is a cutscene and the other half is fancy effects which are truly only there to avoid the player from realizing how boring it is.

Bioshock is not like that, the scenery is truly amazing [i]but you're still in control of it[/i]. To reasonable extent, that is. Bioshock infinite gets a lot of negative attention from people claiming it set apart too much from the original games, and though I'll admit the original setting was more credible than this one, there were plenty unrealistic aspects to not be able to use that as a reasonable argument, or at least that's how i see it.

Wheter you're looking for a challenge or just looking to casually stroll through a beautiful story, be sure to give this game the chance it deserves.

"BioShock Infinite" хмм... игра по истине прекрасная в определённой сфере и до сих пор выглядит очень ярко относительно собратьев. С одной стороны, это очень красивая на декорации, сюжет, персонажей, мир в целом, идею и концепцию вещь. Ирэшанелы создали ещё один восхитительный город-утопию со своими неповторимым обаянием, правилами, особенностями. С другой стороны, то что, по-моему, нельзя называть игрой с интересной механикой, очень уж тут много недочетов. Считаю, что это никак не может быть лучшей игрой 2013. В определённых моментах Я воспринимаю это вообще как некое интерактивное кино, и возможно будь Оно чисто им ощущения были бы лучше.

Сюжет прекрасен. Музыка добавляет атмосферности. Восхитительное оформление города. Типичное оружие и плазмиды, то есть энергетики. Бедноваты бестиарий противников. Немного нарушая атмосфера для меня из-за некоторых моментов. Ужасная и убогая модель сохранений - самый главный минус.

И всё же в итоге могу сказать, что Кен Левин и его команда и студия "Irrational Games" создали необычную, запоминающуюся игру, которую будет приятно пройти за сюжет и замечательное визуальное полотно, но из-за отсутствия какой-либо вариативности этого сюжета и довольна-таки скучноватой механики и игрового процесса, которые хороша смазывается сюжетом в первом прохождении, но всплывают на поверхность на повторных прохождения, но это первое происхождение даст многих просто не забываемые, яркие, восхитительные воспоминания. Лично для меня это один из наилучших представителей в моей библиотек

Absolut Grandios.
Das Spiel hat eine anständige Dauer (sofern man sich die Zeit nimmt alles zu erkunden), einen fordernden Schwierigkeitsgrad (habe es direkt auf Schwer durchgespielt und bin einige male gestorben) und die Möglichkeit, zusätzlich einen "Old-School-Hardcore" Modus frei zu schalten und durch zu spielen.
Die Story ist nach wievor Filmreif und die Grafik gradezu cinetastisch!
Artemberaubende und knifflige Situationen treiben einen Teils grade dazu sich soweit in das Spiel zu vertiefen, das man es am liebsten am Stück durch spielen möchte.
Um nicht zuviel zu verraten möchte ich nur sagen: Beim wachsen zu sehen, beim Handeln ein Träger zu sein und Parallelwelten zu erforschen gehen einem ganz schön unter die Haut...
Одна из причин, почему стоит купить и пройти эту игру - очень продуманный и интересный сюжет! 10 из 10

SImply Amazing! I've never played any of the Bioshock series, so I jumped in with this when the triology was on sale for $11. I've chosen to play Infinite first, and a couple hours in I feel kind of guilty for getting it so cheap - there are few games out there worth $60. This would be one of them. There are few SP games that make into my pantheon of enjoyable time wasted playing video games (e.g., Dishonored, Skyrim, Arkham series..well maybe not Origins, but certainly Asylum, City, and I expect Knight). Great game thus far. Every review I have read says that I have to play at least the original Bioshock, and I will, but Infinite is a delight!

Przyznam, że trzecia część serii mnie mocno zaskoczyła. Po ukończeniu dwóch poprzednich Bioshock-ów, przyznam, że brakowało mi tam rozbudowanego wątku fabularnego. W trzeciej części otrzymujemy potężnie rozbudowany wątek fabularny, przerywany jedynie na sekwencje strzelankowe. O ile fabułę mogę ocenić bardzo bardzo pozytywnie, to ograniczenie Bioshocka do zwykłego FPS nie bardzo mi się spodobało. Ewidentnie brakowało mi eksploracji, która była możliwa w poprzednich częściach, no i która budowała ten cudowny klimat grozy oraz zwątpienia. Generalnie gra się bardzo przyjemnie, fabuła pozostanie bardzo długo w mojej pamięci, no i oczywiście plus za zaskakujące zakończenie.

Plusy: 

- dobrze zrealizowana strzelanka
- doskonały system rozwoju postaci
- dobrze rozplanowane plazmidy
- nawiązanie do uniwersum Bioshock 1 i 2
- ciekawa fabuła
- nie było ani chwili nudy

Minusy:

- zrezygnowano z elementów eksploracji
- brak klimatu grozy

Ocena końcowa, silne 9 na 10 ;)

Сразу говорю, игра шедевр! У игры не плохая подача сюжета, но он и не много запутанный. От финала будет очень много вопросов, но прохождение всех игр BioShock, и два дополнения для BioShock Infinite это исправят. Графика прекрасна. Совсем забыл про Лиз, эта девушка просто идеал во всех смыслах, она ну очень прекрасна. Не знаю как другим людям, но мне игра показалась очень атмосферной, в плане Америки начала 20 века, детали игры очень проработаны и даже любая мелочь приятна. 

До BioShock Infinite я не играл не в одну часть этой серии, но после прохождения этой игры я прошел первую и вторую часть и + два дополнения для BioShock Infinite (про эти два дополнения нужно писать совсем другой обзор). А так игра стоит своих денег, окупает первыми минутами игры.

I keep finding myself thinking about Bioshock Infinite, and how it has made me feel about life, poilitics, relationships and science. It's not just the game itself that makes this great. Its the ideas. The concept of an infinite number of dimensions existing has been around for decades now but I have never seen an art form let alone a video game so carefully and expertly allow a player to live in that kind of world. The gameplay is nothing short of fantastic. Innovative, engrossing and always, ALWAYS, you want to play more. The story (stories?) within this game is something I have never seen before and have nothing to compare it to and would likely be unfair to compare this to any other game including the preceeding Bioshock titles. This is simply the greatest game I have ever played and so completely enjoyed from start to finish.

Цель любой игры, впрочем, как и любого произведения исскуства - дарить людям какие-либо незабываемые эмоции, которые ты будешь помнить на протяжении всей жизни, ну или хотя бы долгого времени. Я играл во множество игр, однако особенно в память врезались лишь некоторые из них, в том числе и Bioshock Infinite. Я не стану говорить, что это идеальная игра, у меня есть много претензий к ней (временами наскучивающий и нудный геймплей, например). Но все они меркнут по сравнению с теми эмоциями, которые подарило данное произведение искусства. Самое главное в этой игре - это атмосфера. Не очень много так прекрасно и глубоко передали атмосферу США начала-первой трети XX века - одну из моих любимых эпох. Это одна из немногих игр, которая держит тебя в своем мире вплодь до конца игры и не хочет отпускать после, заставляя думать о ней, вызывая желание вернуться в ее прекрасный мир. На самом деле, если разбирать игру детально, то в ней найдется невероятное количество минусов и просчетов (сюда же хочу отнести не очень внятную и странную концовку, но это сугубо мое личное мнение). Однако, в данном случае эмоции просто берут верх и заставляют поставить игре 10/10.
One of the Best games ever made 10/10. Season Pass is a must have.
no bad things this game is fantastic

Отличная графика, щикарные пейзажи.
 8.5 из 10

Tja, Bioshock Infinite was soll ich schon großes sagen: das nun doch letzte Spiel von Irrational Games, aus der Feder von Ken Levin, seines Zeichens Story Writer, Gamedesigner und einer der Köpfe hinter System Shock 2.
"Und dann kam Bioshock..."
Nach Bioshock 1 und Bioshock 2 nun doch noch ein weiterer Teil im "selben" Universum, kann dass gut gehen?


Um es kurtz zu machen und mein endgültiges Fazit gleich vorweg zu nehmen:
JA! Verdammt noch mal und wie gut das geht!
Bioshock Infinite ist quasi das "Inception der Videospiele" und ist in Punkto Geschichte und Charakter so gut wie konkurrenzlos.



Aber der Reihe nach:

Einleitung:
Bioshock Infinite spielt, Überraschung!, mal nicht unter wasser sondern über den Wolken.
Dieser Wechsel in der Umgebung wirkt für mich als Bioshock 1 Fan erst mal etwas ungewohnt, schließlich profitierte Bioshock 1 ja gerade von der beklemmenden, düsteren und stark dystopischen Atmosphäre unter wasser...
Infinite hingegen beginnt zwar auf dem Wasser und auch an einem Leuchtturm (ob es sich wohl um den Leuchtturm aus Bioshock 1 handelt, nur zu einer andern Zeit/ in einem andern Universum?...) aber da enden die Gemeinsamheiten in der Umgebung auch schon fast.
Einen Großteil der Geschichte von Infinite verbringt man entweder in mal gut ausgeleuchteten, mal düsteren Gebäuden und natürlich unter freiem Himmel.

Geschichte:
Oh man, hier ist es echt schwer nicht zu "spoilern" deswegen versucht ich hier so schnell wie möglich in Stichpunkten zusammen zu fassen worum es in Infinite geht: "spoiler, spoiler, spoiler...
Oh... Ich lasse dass mit der Zusammenfassung der Geschichte doch besser, aber so viel sei gesagt: Infinite bietet eine für meinen Geschmack sogar noch bessere Geschichte als Bioshock 1, was besonders an denen sehr gut geschriebenen Hauptcharaktern liegt. Auch die Art und Weise die die Geschichte einschlägt hat daran einen großen Anteil, aber wie schon gesagt ist es echt schwer da nicht zu spoilern, deswegen belasse ich es in Punkto Geschichte dabei auch.

Charakter:
Auch hier ohne zu viel zu spoilern: alle Hauptcharakter wirken gut durchdacht und sind sehr glaubwürdig.
Besonders die Beziehung der Charakter untereinander ist extrem komplex und wenn man weiter in der Geschichte ist gibt es die ein oder andere erstaunliche Wendung, die die Motivationen der Personen doch mal infrage stellt...

Grafik:
(Meine Eindrücke beziehen sich auf Infinite unter Hohen/ Maximalen Einstellungen)
Hier punktet Infinite mit hohem Detailgrad und schöner Beleuchtung und noch viel schöneren Umgebungen (der erste Flug nach Columbia, einfach unvergesslich...)
Einziges Manko: an manchen Stellen wirkt Infinite etwas oberflächlich gestalltet und es fehlt an Details, aber dies ist eben auch nur selten der Fall.

Sound:
Auch der ist mit 7.1 Headset echt spitze: die Effekte sind bombastisch, die Musik weiß an den richtigen Stellen leichte Akzente zu setzen. Aber auch hier ein kleines Manko: der Soundtrak ist nicht als zu umfangreich und wiederholt sich schnell, ansonsten gibt es aber nichts zu meckern.

Gameplay:
Hier hat Infinite im Gegensatz zu Bioshock 1 einiges verbessert: das gesamte Kampf-System fühlt sich etwas runder an und ist nicht ganz so gewöhnungsbedürftig wie noch in Bioshock 1.
Es gibt einige Schusswaffen und auch einige Fähigkeiten, scheinbar wollte man hier auf "Klasse statt Masse" setzen, was jedoch besonders bei den Schusswaffen nicht so gut gelingt, da sich diese nicht genug voneinander unterscheiden bzw. einfach etwas zu konservativ wirken. Die Fähigkeiten sind alle samt für bestimmte Situationen sinnvoll, für andere jedoch nicht. Dass geht schon ok, aber auch hier hätte ich mir etwas mehr Vielfalt gewünscht.
Ansonsten gibt es in Sachen Gameplay nicht viel zu kritisieren: das System funktioniert ganz gut, macht auch viel Spaß, nur sind die Gegnermassen manchmal etwas nervig...

Umfang:
Ja, hier könnte man den nur mittelmäßgen Umfang kritisieren, aber alles in allem passt der Umfang schon und es kommt auch zu keinerlei Leerläufen (ich hab Infinite in etwa 14h beendet, jedoch nicht alles gefunden...)

Fazit:
Wie oben schon erwähnt: Bioshock Infinite ist einfach großartig: Charakter und Geschichte sind super und das Ende ist echt überraschen.
Für alle die eine Bewertung mit Punkten wollen: 92 von 100 könnte ich hier reinen gewissens geben.
Alles in allem lohnt sich der Kauf auf jeden Fall und ich empfehle Bioshock Infinite uneingeschränkt an jedermann der auch nur im entferntesten mit Videospielen zu tun hat.

BIOShock infnite is fan game ant goot game

Now let me be clear, i am huge fan of the first game, i adore system shock 2 and deus ex, The original Bioshock was spiritual succsesor to these games, i liked that strategic combat, hacking stuff, managing your bullets, weapons, a lot of plasmids to play with, passives, droids and stuff like that. I didn't really enjoy bioshock 2, for me it was just a cheap cash-in on already established formula, but still that game improved on some combat mechanics without dumbing it down terribly. And then ladies and gentelmen  Bioshock infinite comes up, it is a total letdown gameplaywise, it's no more a thinking man's game, there're no more usefull hacks, passives became extremelly situational, plasmids (vigors) became less fun. they aren't simply as diverse as they were in first game. you will probably end up spamming one or two. Now gunplay,Bioshock 1 had bad gunplay, let's face it, but at least you can carry a lot of weapons at a time, here not that gunplay is improved, apparently booker can't carry more than 2 weapons, it is a shame, and really insulting to game's roots. there are also no puzzles.
Story and Atmosphere  superb in both games. But i still prefer Bioshock 1's story about betrail, and that amazing plot twist. (ending sucked tho), Here we get more complete ending, which essentially is infodumping last 20 minutes of the game, and it works, don't get me wrong, but i think it just could have been done in a better way. Atmospherewise Infinite is very scripted, i mean elizabeth will dance there till the end of the times, if you don't pull her off.
Enemies, i think it's a tie here, i think Handyman was alright, boys of silence were pretty scary, but that siren boss was recycled 3 times, 3 fuckin times, it's just lazy. Nothing will ever compare to big daddy for me.
So i can say if you have played first game, liked it, and want some "more of the same" go and get bioshock 2. 
Otherwise Bioshock infintie is a great game, it's just not the game i was expecting from maker of one of best games ever made, it's good but totally different. Play it for the story and for the atmosphere. Don't expect a masterpiece like the first one was tho.

Not your father's Bioshock

I quite enjoyed Bioshock Infinite.  The story is really about the connection between the main character and Elizabeth, and the emotion built into this relationship, expressed through extemporaneous dialog throughout, is what really drives it.  Most of the weapons are fairly standard, and as in previous Bioshock games, your powers add more variety to the game play.  The atmosphere is very different from previous Bioshock games, however, rather than the creepy, stealthy atmosphere of Rapture, Colombia is much more open and bright, removing some of those elements of terror (which was good for me).  The use of the sky hook and Elizabeth's abilities further add to variety in gameplay mechanics and styles, but it is fundamentally the dynamism between the characters that makes it unforgettable.

When I first started playing this game I wasn't all that interested in it. However, after around 30 minutes of playing I started to enjoy it and the more I played the more I became attracted to the it. By the time I finished playing through it I was in awe at this masterpiece. There are so many different aspects to this game that I enjoy it is hard to find fault with this game at all. 

Graphics: This game is designed in a way that my eyes can't get enough of. I couldn't find a thing wrong with the way it looked. It's opulence, it's grit, it's gore, all thing's are done immensely well, it's faultless to look at.

Gameplay: As I have stated, the first 30 minutes to an hour are a bit tedious, mainly scene setting areas and mechanics demos, but after it, you start to feel more immersed and generally the playability of the game is fantastic. One problem, probably the only one I had, was the sky-line. Yeah, it's cool, but you fall from heights that if you jumped from would kill you. Bit dis-illusioning.

Story and plot: Epic. intangible. Fun to follow. I will say no more.

Characters: I loved the characters in this game. It has true character development the likes of which I have only ever seen in a handful of other games. I actually cared for and loathed the characters I were supposed to, instead of them just being the usual story guidance props they seem to be nowadays.

Most things in this game are near-perfect, but I could pick a couple of small things out that I didn't exactly love, such as the difficulty. It's pretty consistant but in a few cases it spikes massively for no real reason. Also, the Vigors aren't really of any use. At all. Like, I played through the full game and never really used them at all.
10/10 story. Sad that Elizabeth isn't real.

I thoroughly enjoyed every minute in this game and strongly recommend trying it. 10/10

Ever wanted to brutally a murder full town of people? Have you wanted to emerse yourself in a world where you take down an entire city's government, start a revolt, and commence great chaos? Do you like your mind screwed with? If you answered yes to any of these questions boy is this the game for you.

You're Book Dewitt, and you start on a boat being rowed to a lighthouse. Why? Good question. That's the whole thing, you really don't know. One of the people rowing the boat hands you a box. Inside the boss you find a luger and a note. This is where the whole adventure starts and it gets deeper than Rapture. 

I haven't really been into the Bioshock series, I've played some of the first but lost interest. Bioshock Infite is like a whole different game. It's graphics and smooth motion gameplay is impressed me when I first started, and actually continued to awe me throughout. The background is constantly in motion with clouds and other parts of the city. The city you'll explore is brightened by the sun, with no overcast it seems brighter and gives the game a tranquil feel. This feeling is mixed though with tension because sooner or later you're going to have to fight, more often than not. You see, you're not really liked there. The combat is great. You will push your way to your goals using a variety of weapons at your disposal which you can upgrade andyour  beyond human abilities. What is really the best part of the game is the story.
The ending left me like ":O huuuuh?" cause it's something so deep you really have to pay attention during the game but that's where the replay value comes in. I'll play it again someday. 

One more thing that is note worthy, this game is pretty much one big escort mission but this time the escortee doesn't suck. You will have a companion with you but they are not ones that get in the way or hold you back, they actually keep up and even throw you supplies like ammo and health during combat. Which I thought was just great. Also, boobs, that is all.

Overall I give this game a 10 out of 10 MF Falco's, I mean.....I just can't think of anything that is bad about this game.....it's wierd, kinda freaks me out........thx for reading! Thumbs up!

I beat this game in one long 10hr sit down session and this is probobly one of the best games i have ever had the pleasure to play. It has a great story to it that will blow your mind i really recommend you buy this game.
It has a much different feel than the previous two Bioshock games, but not in a bad way. This game feels like more of an FPS than a survival horror shooter.
